text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.
author: Steve Jobs

text: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: John Johnson

text: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it's bad.
author: Cory House

text: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
author: Kent Beck

text: The best error message is the one that never shows up.
author: Thomas Fuchs

text: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.
author: Austin Freeman

text: Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable.
author: Ralph Johnson

text: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
author: Harold Abelson

text: The most damaging phrase in the language is: 'We've always done it this way.'
author: Grace Hopper

text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Faith is taking the first step even when you don't see the whole staircase.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Take care of your body. It’s the only place you have to live.
author: Jim Rohn

text: We rise by lifting others.
author: Robert Ingersoll

text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

text: The future depends on what you do today.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.
author: Mother Teresa

text: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Courage is grace under pressure.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: You must do the thing you think you cannot do.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Faith is to believe what you do not see; the reward of faith is to see what you believe.
author: Saint Augustine

text: Let us always meet each other with a smile, for the smile is the beginning of love.
author: Mother Teresa

text: What we fear doing most is usually what we most need to do.
author: Tim Ferriss

text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: Joy is not in things; it is in us.
author: Richard Wagner

text: Work hard, be kind, and amazing things will happen.
author: Conan O'Brien

text: It is not the mountain we conquer but ourselves.
author: Sir Edmund Hillary

text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
author: Arthur Ashe

text: Do not wait for leaders; do it alone, person to person.
author: Mother Teresa

text: What you do makes a difference, and you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make.
author: Jane Goodall

text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: What good is warmth without cold to give it sweetness?
author: John Steinbeck

text: Success is a journey, not a destination.
author: Arthur Ashe

text: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
author: Robert Frost

text: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: We become what we think about.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
author: Aristotle

text: When we strive to become better than we are, everything around us becomes better too.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: The pain you feel today is the strength you feel tomorrow.
author: Thomas Carlyle

text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: We must let go of the life we have planned, so as to accept the one that is waiting for us.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth, faithfulness the best relationship.
author: Buddha

text: The only journey is the one within.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

text: Do or do not. There is no try.
author: Yoda

text: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Leadership is not about being in charge. It is about taking care of those in your charge.
author: Simon Sinek

text: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
author: Aesop

text: Everything you’ve ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
author: George Addair

text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: Do not let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.
author: John Wooden

text: To love another person is to see the face of God.
author: Victor Hugo

text: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Your life is your message to the world. Make it inspiring.
author: Lorrin L. Lee

text: What you think, you become. What you feel, you attract. What you imagine, you create.
author: Buddha

text: Out of difficulties grow miracles.
author: Jean de La Bruyère

text: If you want to lift yourself up, lift up someone else.
author: Booker T. Washington
